roleset.name: un-associate
roleset.note: DISASSOCIATE-V NOTES: The first two usages seem to be specialized and mean something like'fall apart'. (from disassociate.01-v)

example.name: oddly ergative
example.text: When an electric current is applied to the palladium and platinum electrodes, [the heavy water]-3 did begin [*-3]to break up, or disassociate.

example.name: transitive
example.text: It-2 would go along [*-2]-3 doing nothing but [*-3]disassociating the heavy water and then at totally unpredictable times, it would begin producing excess heat for as long as 10 or 11 hours before quieting down.

example.name: actually from disassociate
example.text: ``[The market]-1 is beginning [*-1]to disassociate itself from Wall Street,'' said one New York trader.
